numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice an increase in world electricity generation between 2000 and 2022.
2. Clean energy sources produced more electricity than fossil fuel sources between 2000 and 2022.
3. Clean energy sources gained more than 10 million gigawatt-hours between 2000 and 2022.
4. Fossil fuel sources gained at most 8 million gigawatt-hours between 2000 and 2022.
5. The second figure shows the total electricity generation of China.
6. The total electricity generation of China increased dramatically.
7. In China, fossil electricity generation increased from about 1 million gigawatt-hours to about 5.5 million gigawatt-hours.
8. In China, clean electricity generation increased to about 7 million gigawatt-hours.
9. In China, clean electricity generation increased to about 8 million gigawatt-hours.
10. The electricity generation of China is higher than the electricity generation of the United States.
11. The electricity generation of China is higher than the electricity generation of India.
12. During the last 20 years, clean electricity generation in the United States stayed fairly steady.
13. During the last 20 years, fossil electricity generation in the United States decreased.
14. I wonder how population affects the need for fossil fuels compared to clean power.
15. The population of China is larger than the population of the United States.
16. I ask whether the larger population of China is a reason for the increase of electricity generation in China.
17. I ask why the electricity generation of the United States increased so little.
18. This topic relates to my community.
19. We are a new generation.
20. Clean energy is the future.
21. It is our job to take care of the planet.
22. It is our duty to take care of the planet.
23. A catchy headline is: Are fossil fuels a thing of the past - clean versus fossil energy production from 2000 to 2022.
